entry.title: Orienteering World Cup Nominations Reopen: Round 3 & 4
entry.summary: OA is reopening nominations to represent Australia in rounds 3 and 4 of the World Cup. Nominations close 19 May at 11:59pm. Orienteering World Cup Nominations Reopen: Round 3 & 4 first appeared on Orienteering Australia.

entry.title: WOC 2029 awarded to Sweden
entry.summary: The forest World Orienteering Championships in 2029 will take place in Örnskjoldsvik, Sweden. That was decided by IOF Council during a meeting on Friday. WOC 2029 will be the fifth World Championships taking place in Sweden – the most recent being WOC 2016 in Strömstad. Sweden also made a bid for the World Orienteering Championships […]

entry.title: Prices are Falling
entry.summary: Membership prices for new members are now reduced for the remainder of the year, so if you have been thinking of joining now is a great time. Prices from 1 May are: Adult £16 (was £25) Young Adult £12 (was £20) Junior £6 (was £10)... The post Prices are Falling appeared first on NI Orienteering Association.

entry.title: View from the Chair Sullivan | April 2024
entry.summary: How amazing was Nationals at Easter? Amazingis the answer! OBOP and Taupō Clubs excelled in hosting over 700 orienteers during the four-day event, providing challenging courses on demanding maps. It was a delight to experience the high-quality navigation, where losing contact with the map or concentration could result in significant mistakes. Our selectors have been busy choosing various […] View from the Chair Sullivan | April 2024 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: King’s Birthday Weekend | Entries closing soon
entry.summary: Entries for King’s Birthday Orienteering Champs closing soon!What do you need to know about Nelson Orienteering Club’s (NOC) King’s Birthday this year? • All taking place on the way to and in stunning Golden Bay, one bay ‘over’ from Nelson;• A compact, high quality orienteering weekend, with the first start on Saturday at 1PM, and […] King’s Birthday Weekend | Entries closing soon first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: AOC 2024 | Australian Orienteering Championship Carnival
entry.summary: The Armidale / Uralla region is the location for this years AOC from 28 September – 6 October 2024. It is a section of the Granite Belt which runs along the Great Dividing Range. The Granite Belt has played host to many State and National Championship events. The Australian Middle, Relay and Long Championships will […] AOC 2024 | Australian Orienteering Championship Carnival first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: North Island Secondary School Champs
entry.summary: Over Anzac weekend, North West Club hosted the North Island Secondary Schools Champs for 2024. 400 students from year 7 to year 13 lined up for the Sprint on Thursday afternoon at AUT Akoranga. Course Setter, Renee Beveridge, known for setting tricky, technical courses, made great use of the complex labyrinth of small classrooms that are […] North Island Secondary School Champs first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Taitonga South Island Champs | Ōtepoti Dunedin
entry.summary: Feedback from the event: “The weekend was like a three-course banquet -– three very different terrains, great courses wonderfully cooked up and served, and even a thoughtfully placed piece of warning tape marking some ongaonga in the middle of a kānuka stand!“ The long weekend started with the sprint on Anzac Day afternoon on a […] Taitonga South Island Champs | Ōtepoti Dunedin first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Summer coach in residence | Applications open
entry.summary: Do you know of a coach who would enjoy coming to spend the Summer in South Island? This coming NZ Summer PAPO is offering a scholarship for a Coach in Residence. The scholarship is aimed at University aged orienteers from outside of New Zealand who are looking to improve their Orienteering and Coaching skills. (p.s. […] Summer coach in residence | Applications open first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Canterbury MTBO Weekend
entry.summary: On the 13th April around 100 enthusiastic mountain bike orienteers gathered at Bottle Lake forest, north of Christchurch, to compete in PAPO’s first ever MTB ‘enduro’ orienteering event. In a format piloted by Central Otago Orienteers in 2023, the race consisted of a series of shorter MTBO courses linked together with untimed rides between maps. […] Canterbury MTBO Weekend first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Australian MTBO Champs | Event information
entry.summary: Australian MTBO Carnival and Championships 2024, 17-20 October in Canberra BULLETIN 2 is now ready here:https://bit.ly/AUSMTBO24-Bull2 Accommodation partner:Alivio Tourist Park became a Carnival Accommodation Partner and for all interstate and overseas participants they provide a 15% discount. Min booking 2 nights and offer is available for all MTBOers from April until November. Please use an exclusive code “MTBO” while […] Australian MTBO Champs | Event information first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Podcast: 10Mila preview with IOF TV expert commentator Jonas Merz
entry.summary: This weekend, the prestigious 10Mila relays take place in Nynäshamn in eastern Sweden with more than 6000 athletes. IOF TV airs all three relays – Youth, Women’s and 10Mila – from Saturday afternoon and until Sunday before noon, when the Women’s relay is decided. Go to IOF TV In this episode of the IOF Podcast, […]

entry.title: Auckland Regional Events | Relay & Forest Events
entry.summary: The transition to forest orienteering begins in Term 2. Competition events can feel a little daunting. There is support available at the forest event on 12 May, in Woodhill Forest with experienced senior secondary school students around to help you out and get you started. Send an email detailing your name, age and where you live, […] Auckland Regional Events | Relay & Forest Events first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Manawatū school champs | Entries closing soon
entry.summary: The Manawatu Schools Champs is Friday, 10 May, a reminder that all entries are due by Friday 3 May. Be sure to work with your sport teachers as registrations are through Schools via the RedKiwi website. Any questions? Please email red.kiwi.o@gmail.com Register here Manawatū school champs | Entries closing soon first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Southland schools | Entries close 13 May
entry.summary: Your school sports coordinator will have received the info for entering the 2024 Southland Schools Orienteering Champs. This is open for beginners too, and you can enter in pairs or on your own, so don’t be afraid to give it a go! It’s only $10 per entry (pairs will pay a fiver each). Entries are […] Southland schools | Entries close 13 May first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Zespri AIMS Games | Is your school registered?
entry.summary: The Zespri AIMS Games is Australasia’s largest junior sporting event, held annually in Tauranga Moana. It gives 11, 12 & 13 year olds an opportunity to compete with invited countries and fellow kiwi kids in 27 codes or sports. This is the first year that orienteering will be included in AIMS games, so it is […] Zespri AIMS Games | Is your school registered? first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Get to know Marcus Diprose | Incoming ONZ Board Member

What motivated you to join an orienteering club?I believe I joined OBOP around 2007, but I was orienteering before that by running in the Auckland […] Get to know Marcus Diprose | Incoming ONZ Board Member first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Controller’s Clinic | Taranaki
entry.summary: FREE! Join us for a two-day controllers clinic with practical field exercises on local maps for the weekend of Saturday and Sunday 18-19 May (9:00am to approx 3:30pm each day) at New Plymouth Girls High School. Open to all club members involved in event organisation – the aim to certify qualified controllers. entry.title: Oceania 2025 Update | Lower North Island Region
entry.summary: Planning is underway for an absolute treat of orienteering for Oceania 2025. You’ll most probably fly into Wellington and get to experience our coastal capital city with a harbour and countless beaches before you head into some forest terrain. We are still finalising the actual timing on the calendar year with our Australian mates. The first set of […] Oceania 2025 Update | Lower North Island Region first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.title: Orienteering NZ annual report | 2023
entry.summary: The 2023 ONZ annual report is on the website providing an overview of our performance, o and activities during the past year. It is our own record of results and provides transparency and accountability regarding our financial performance, governance practices, and strategic direction. View it here Orienteering NZ annual report | 2023 first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.

entry.summary: The new South West League is a replacement for the old Munster League. The big plus is that it reduces distances to events and takes advantage of the improved N22 road network.
